climbs.name: Mescalero
climbs.fa: Kevin Keith, Kathy Schroeder and others

content.description: Climb steep face to slab to reach the bolted anchor. Four bolts for protection. Rap from chains on El Deguello
content.location: Second route from the right, the red route on the topo photo

content.description: Climb past 5 bolts on a blunt and rounded arete past several "holes" and pockets to odd black diorite protrusions.
content.location: See Blue route on topo photo

climbs.name: Fandango
climbs.fa: Kevin Keith, Kathy Schroeder and others

content.description: On the right side of the wall climb up using the shallow left facing dihedral and the flake out right. Move up and left to gain a shallow pod and a horizontal. Continue upward on slab to anchor.

climbs.name: El Loco
climbs.fa: Kevin Keith, Josh Bradley and Wayne Augusto

content.description: Boulder up past a bolt to a small ledge. Continue up a thin flake with bolts and gear for protection. A thin steep lieback leads to a horizontal that accepts small cams. Finish with a steep boulder problem.
content.location: This is the left most route on the topo photo.

climbs.name: El Degüello
climbs.fa: Cougan Carothers, Kevin Keith and Jarrod Webb

content.description: Climb the steep finger crack to a surprisingly tricky slab move to reach a chain anchor.
content.location: High on the Rock Stacker trail in the center of the Top Wall. It is the obvious center crack. This is the White dotted line on the Topo photo.

content.description: Short cliff along the Rock Stacker Trail off of Granite Gardens Drive in the Oasis Climbing Area. These routes are about 50 feet tall and provide a quick sunny outing. Routes face southwest and tend to have morning shade and sun till dark.
